channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking, 3rd September
item.description:
Van parked on bridge over cycle lane No enforcement officers about on a continued parking violation area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hertford Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There has been a recent influx of graffiti along Thornton Street SW9 6AG. The graffiti unfortunately leads from 296-298 Brixton along to 10 Thornton Street SW9., 3rd September
item.description:
The graffiti at 10 Thornton Street SW9 6AG starts from one end and leads all along to Robstart Street SW9, it is very visible. The graffiti has been there for over a week. Please can the graffiti be removed it unfortunately encourages more opportunists to come along.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornton Street, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public footpath 99 - Overgrown vines/branches causing a nuisance and hazard, 3rd September
item.description:
The two households either side of this public footpath have allowed their fruit vines/trees to overgrow into the footpath to become a public nuisance and hazard to users of this footpath. Aside from being a nuisance having to brush past this overgrown vegetation (particularly in wet weather), the fruit that has dropped off these vines/trees presents a slip/fall hazard. This situation has previously been reported to Bexley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
